titleStmt.title: F. B. McClary et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2645

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Whereas there is a vacancy in the office of magistrate in the 2nd District of Rockcastle County Ky. occassioned by the resignation of Tolbert Bowman Esqr. now we the undersigned being neighbors of Newton Whitehead and desiring to have some qualified person to fill said vacancy -- do hereby recommend the said Whitehead to your Excellencys consideration as a fit and proper person to fill the same
Jany 8th 1862

Names
F B McClary Atto
James. M. Smith
Jas C. Jones
Cty Atty
B K Bothurum Judge
of the Rockcastle court
D G Colyer Co clk

Rockcastle Co.
J. P.
N. Whitehead
Dist No 2
vice
J. Bowman
resigned
Com Issd. Jany 14. 1862
